result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Bernard Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant is advised:  as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are supsended during the length of this sentence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Bernard Grant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (15 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 12, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   
AS to count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 9 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 186 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS 
AS to count 3:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS  in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to count 2.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Register as a sex offender.
-No contact with victim, SLP.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
  
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Attorney Michael S. Winter in court, defendant Kevin Bernard Grant not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial; sentencing was set for 8:15 and defense counsel did not appear until 8:40.  Court will adjourn matter to 9-12-2014 at 8:15.

Attorney Michael S. Winter in court, defendant Kevin Bernard Grant not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for sentencing hearing.  ADA Williams is in trial in another court and requests an adjurned sentencing date, no objection from defense counsel.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Count 2: Third Degree Sexual Assault, class G felony, 940.225(3)
Count 3: Substantial Battery(substantial bodily harm with intent to cause bodily harm), a class I felony, 940.19(2)
Order signed and filed.

Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have resolved matter.  Pursuant to negotiations the court orders counts 1 and 4 dismissed and read in; Count 2 is ordered amended to THIRD DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT,  a class G felony 940.225(3).
As to counts 2 and 3:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
The Court will order a PSI and remand defendant pending sentencing on 8-27-2014 at 8:15am.

Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel advises the Court that his expert report has been turned over to the State and that an offer is in place.  A formal written offer is to be presented to defendant later today.  At this time the defendant WAIVES his speedy trial demand and requests a plea date.
The Court finds the waiver to be made freely and voluntarily.  Case is adjourned to 7-21-2014 at 1:30pm for plea.

Atty Winter is requesting that the final pretrial be put over to 7-18-2014 as ADA Jennifer Williams has been in trial all week and they have not been able to discuss expert's report.  ADA Williams has no objection.  FInal pretrial set for 7-18-2014.

Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in court with attorney Michael S Winter.  Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery packet will be completed and ready for defense counsel to pick up tomorrow.  ADA Williams will be picking up the packet from state crime lab today.  Atty Winter will provide report to DNA expert for review.  The Court will vacate the 6-23-2014 jury trial date.  Jury trial date of 7-21-2014 previously set as a back-up date to be used.  The Court will set another final pretrial on 7-17-2014, the Court will accept no negotiations or plea bargains after 7-17-2014.

Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in court with attorney Michael S Winter.  Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court is advised that the DNA reports have not been received yet.  Defense counsel is requesting that the June 23 jury trial date be changed to a later dated within the speedy trial period (7-29-2014).
The court will set another final pretrial date on 6-10-2014 to find out the status of the DNA reports.  The current trial date of 6-23-2014 will remain and the court will set a BACK UP trial date of 7-21-2014.
Speedy trial demand in writing received and filed. (expires 7-29-2014)
Defense motion to modify bail is aruged and DENIED. $50,000 cash bail is to stand.

Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in court with attorney Michael S Winter.  Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Steven Sargent is allowed to withdraw as counsel as new counsel has been retained.
Discovery hsa been provided to Atty Winter.  Atty Winter is available for the previously set dates.
Any motions/witness lists are to be filed by 5-27-2014.
to Reduce Bail filed by defense.

Atty Winter requests that a date be set for bail hearing and status.  Counsel is available for scheduled dates of 6-2-2014 and 6-23-2014.
Defendant to be present on 4-25-2014.
ADA Jennifer Williams is emailed date to appear.
filed by Atty Michael S. WInter
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Sargent.
filed by State
filed by State

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kevin Bernard Grant not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense will withdraw request for bail hearing and advises that there is no need for a Miranda-Goodchild hearing.
Case set for final pretrial on 6-2-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-23-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 4-21-2014.  Any evidentiary matters are to be heard on final pretrial date.

Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Steve Wells-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SABRINA P., ROBERT G., AND JESSICA N. OR THEIR FAMILY/RESIDENCE(S)/WORK/SCHOOL.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kevin Bernard Grant in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
